args:
Leif, White Sparrow knight of Alberia, has yet
to stage a counterattack. Vice Captain Patia
grows impatient, but then learns that Leif
has been gathering intel while waiting for
the perfect moment to strike. Just then, a
mysterious invitation arrives...
I had hoped we would find a royal ally in\nLeonidas, and yet here we are.
Are there none other than His Majesty\nwho we can trust? Has everyone else\nalready bent the knee to the Empire?
It could be so. Still, it's a bit premature\nto give in to despair.
Just because every nearby territory has\nyielded to the Empire does not mean\nthey are all our enemies.

There may be some who have fallen
in line with the Empire out of fear or
self-preservation who yet remain on
the side of Alberia.
A nation is like a family. Even if it is torn\napart, those we care about still remain.
Thanks to you, we were able to repel\nthe attack of the rokkan rebel army.\nClearly, our forces are superior.
I entrust you with continuing the campaign.\nAs for me, I must return to the captain.
Captain! I can take no more!
Just how long are the White Sparrows\nplanning to yield to the whims of the\nDyrenell Empire?
Ours is a noble order, granted autonomous\nauthority by the Alberian royal family!
The White Sparrow Corps can accept no\nrestrictions or leash, even if it means\nopposing king and country!
And yet, we obey these people? Why?!
It is the trend of the times.
That is no answer, and you well know it!
A proposal, Captain: With things as they\nnow stand, let us simply cross blades\nwith Empress Zethia.
The Empress has lost her sanity. If we can\nat least strike a blow, I would gladly give\nmy life! Please, Captain! Give the word!
Very well. I will make a decision.
We will depart the capital and wait\ncarefully for the right opportunity.
You would run instead of fight?!
Do you have feelings for Empress Zethia?\n...Or have you simply lost your nerve?
The White Sparrow conquers\nand then returns.
In other words, we leave the capital that\nwe might come back with a dragon in tow.
The Imperials believe that because\nthey took the capital by force,\nAlberia has been defeated.
But the heart of Alberia does not lie\nin its capital.

The heart of Alberia is in the blood of
dragons. And so long as that bloodline
continues, the Imperials can raze every
city to the ground and never defeat us.
The next king WILL strike back at\nthose who have raised the flag of\nrevolution. I am certain of it.
Thus was it necessary for us to remain\nhere in service to that eventual\ncounterattack.
Yes. I have been gathering intelligence.\nOn the structure of the Empire and such.
However, I now have enough.\nThe time has come to spread the wings\nI have been resting for so very long.
I should have known that you would\nhave such deep and intricate plans...
I AM a bit displeased, however.
Because we don't rush headlong into war?
Because you did not speak a word\nof this to me!
And would you have been willing to wait\npatiently while I gathered the necessary\ninformation for this plan?

You are many things, Patia, but patient
is not one of them. You would have chafed
under the pressure and eventually taken
flight from the capital.
I do. I know you very well indeed.\nAnd now that our minds are made up...
(Where should we go first if we're to\nunite against the Empire...?)
It's a letter addressed to you, sir.\nSome manner of invitation.
A letter? No, it can't be...
